federation.title: Fediverse Interactions
federation.explanation: This content has been shared on the Fediverse (Mastodon, Lemmy, etc.) and has received interactions from users on other federated platforms.
federation.stats_info: These metrics are independent from the platform's votes and karma. They represent the reach of this content across the Fediverse.

page.title: The Fediverse
page.subtitle: What it is, how it works, and how we connect to it

what_is_fediverse.title: What is the Fediverse?
what_is_fediverse.description: The Fediverse (from "federation" and "universe") is a collection of decentralized and interconnected social networks. Unlike centralized platforms like Twitter or Facebook, where a single company controls everything, the Fediverse is made up of thousands of independent servers that can communicate with each other.
what_is_fediverse.protocol: All these platforms use an open protocol called ActivityPub, which allows users from different services to interact with each other. It's similar to how email works between different providers: a Gmail user can write to an Outlook user without any issues.

platforms.title: Fediverse Platforms
platforms.description: The Fediverse includes decentralized alternatives to almost any social network you know:
platforms.lemmy: forums and communities, alternative to Reddit
platforms.friendica: full social network, alternative to Facebook
platforms.mbin: content aggregator similar to this platform

our_approach.title: Our connection to the Fediverse
our_approach.description: We connect to the Fediverse in a particular way that preserves the integrity of our community while expanding the reach of your content.
our_approach.do_item_1: We publish your submissions to the Fediverse so users on Mastodon, Lemmy and other platforms can see and follow them
our_approach.do_item_2: We receive comments from external users, which appear clearly identified as federated
our_approach.do_item_3: We show federated interactions (likes, shares) as reach metrics
our_approach.do_item_4: We allow users from other platforms to follow our content
our_approach.dont_item_1: We don't import posts from other instances to the main feed
our_approach.dont_item_2: We don't sync votes or karma with the Fediverse
our_approach.dont_item_3: We don't allow remote users to vote in our karma system

why_this_model.title: Why this model?
why_this_model.description: We are a content aggregation platform where the local community decides what's relevant through votes. If we imported external posts or allowed federated votes, we would lose control over the quality and relevance of the content you see.
why_this_model.benefits: This approach gives you the best of both worlds: your content can reach a much larger audience through the Fediverse, while the experience within the platform continues to be managed by our community. Federated comments enrich discussions without compromising the karma system.

privacy.title: Privacy and control
privacy.description: Your privacy is important. Federation is optional and you decide what to share:
privacy.item_1: Federation is disabled by default on your account
privacy.item_2: You can choose which posts are federated and which are not
privacy.item_3: Your shared profile information is minimal: only username and avatar
privacy.item_4: You can disable federation at any time
privacy.item_5: Your votes, karma and internal activity are never shared externally

metrics.title: Local vs federated metrics
metrics.description: It's important to understand the difference between local metrics (from our platform) and federated ones (from the Fediverse):
metrics.votes_federated: Likes from external users, reach metric only

how_to_enable.title: How to enable federation
how_to_enable.description: Federation is optional. If you want your content to reach the Fediverse:
how_to_enable.step_1: Go to Settings in your profile
how_to_enable.step_4: Optionally, configure what type of content you want to share
